text: Module "rich text". Can we deactivate some styles in editor (if I don't want to give de ability to change font size, can I do it)?

There is no way at this time to disable specific features of the rich text field.

You could however create your own module, and provide a text field instead of rich text. This would remove all of the formatting options in the editor.

Thanks Jon. Yes, but I want to give the abity to change bold, italic, and to insert a list *without insert manually html tags*. I cannot write a javascript in my module to access to a selection in a text field in order to apply a style to it (the js in a module just act on the rendered HTML, not in editor options). Do you know a way to create a bold button (for example) to apply bold just to a text selection in editor?
Currently there is no way to limit the features of the rich text module, and the normal text field does not support formatting. Perhaps providing help text is the best solution.
Maybe you can filter the content when rendering with the function regex_replace.
You mean I filter all tags added by the editor except bold, italic, and list?
I thought I would do it by playing with classes and styles that remove the settings, but it's more effective as you say. Thanks Thomas.
